verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
Nuun. By the pen, and by what they write.
By the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.
In fact, you will have an unending reward.
And you are of a great moral character.
You will see, and they will see.
Which of you is the afflicted.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best the well-guided.
So do not obey the deniers.
They wish that you would compromise, so they would compromise.
And do not obey any vile swearer.
Backbiter, spreader of slander.
Preventer of good, transgressor, sinful.
Rude and fake besides.
Just because he has money and children.

verses.verseString: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: When Our Verses are recited to him, he says, “Myths of the ancients!”
We will mark him on the snout.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.verseStringB: We tested them, as We tested the owners of the garden—when they vowed to harvest it in the morning.
And they made no exception.

verses.verseString: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ مِنْ رَبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But a disaster from your Lord went around it while they slept.
And it became as if picked.
In the morning, they called one another.

verses.verseString: أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَارِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: “Go early to your plantation, if you want to harvest.”
So they set out, whispering to one another.

verses.verseString: أَنْ لَا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِسْكِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: “No poor person is to enter it upon you today.”
And they proceeded early, resolved in intent.
But when they saw it, they said, “We are lost.
In fact, we are deprived.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ لَكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The most moderate of them said, “Did I not say to you, ‘if only you would praise?’”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “Glory be to our Lord—We were in the wrong.”
Then they turned to one another, blaming one another.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “Woe to us—we were domineering.

verses.verseString: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَا أَنْ يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Perhaps our Lord will give us a better substitute for it. We are turning to our Lord in hope .”

verses.verseString: كَذَٰلِكَ الْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Such is the punishment. But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater—if they only knew.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: For the righteous are Gardens of Delight with their Lord.
Shall We treat the submitters like the villains?
What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
Or do you have a scripture in which you study?
That you will have in it whatever you choose?

verses.verseString: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَانٌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or do you have oaths from Us, binding until Resurrection Day, that whatever you demand is yours?
Ask them, which of them will guarantee that!

verses.verseString: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners—if they are truthful.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَنْ سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: On the Day when the Shin will be exposed, and they will be called to bow down, but they will be unable.

verses.verseString: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Their eyes subdued, covered with shame. They were invited to prostrate when they were sound.

verses.verseString: فَذَرْنِي وَمَنْ يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُمْ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So leave Me to those who reject this message. We will proceed against them gradually, from where they do not know.
And I will give them time. My plan is firm.

verses.verseString: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or are you asking them for a fee, so they are burdened with debt?
Or do they know the future, and so they write it down?

verses.verseString: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُنْ كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
verses.verseStringB: So be patient with your Lord’s Judgment. And do not be like the Fellow of the Whale who cried out in despair.

verses.verseString: لَوْلَا أَنْ تَدَارَكَهُ نِعْمَةٌ مِنْ رَبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
verses.verseStringB: Had the blessing from his Lord not reached him, he would have been thrown onto the barren shore, and he was blamed.
But his Lord chose him, and He made him of the righteous.

verses.verseString: وَإِنْ يَكَادُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.verseStringB: Those who disbelieve almost stab you with their glances when they hear the message, and they say, “He is crazy!”
But it is only a reminder for humankind.
